mainBoard.flavorText: This secret society of mages manipulates the beliefs and opinions of others.
mainBoard.name: Architects of Will
mainBoard.originalText:
When Architects of Will enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order.
Cycling {UB} ({UB}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

mainBoard.text:
When Architects of Will enters, look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order.
Cycling {U/B} ({U/B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

mainBoard.name: Duplicant
mainBoard.originalText:
Imprint — When Duplicant enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
As long as the exiled card is a creature card, Duplicant has that card's power, toughness, and creature types. It's still a Shapeshifter.

rulings.text: Abilities that define a * in a creature's power and toughness apply while that card is in exile, but abilities that add or subtract power and toughness don't. For example, the ability of Crusader of Odric applies to determine Duplicant's power and toughness, but the ability of Death's Shadow doesn't.
Duplicant's base power and toughness change to the imprinted card's power and toughness. Counters and other effects that modify Duplicant's power and toughness still apply.
Duplicant's power and toughness are constantly updated if the exiled card's power and/or toughness change.

If a melded permanent or a merged permanent is exiled by Duplicant's triggered ability, that ability's controller chooses the relative timestamp of the exiled cards. Duplicant looks at the information of the one with the latest timestamp.

mainBoard.text:
Imprint — When Duplicant enters, you may exile target nontoken creature.
As long as a card exiled with Duplicant is a creature card, Duplicant has the power, toughness, and creature types of the last creature card exiled with Duplicant. It's still a Shapeshifter.

mainBoard.name: Ethersworn Shieldmage
mainBoard.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Ethersworn Shieldmage enters the battlefield, prevent all damage that would be dealt to artifact creatures this turn.

rulings.text: When Ethersworn Shieldmage’s triggered ability resolves, it doesn’t lock in which permanents will be affected. For the rest of the turn, any time damage would be dealt to a permanent, check whether it’s an artifact creature at that time. If it is, that damage is prevented.

mainBoard.text:
Flash
When Ethersworn Shieldmage enters, prevent all damage that would be dealt to artifact creatures this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Built with neither a way to steer nor a way to stop, the juggernauts were simply aimed at an enemy's best defenses and told to charge.
mainBoard.name: Juggernaut
mainBoard.originalText:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

rulings.text: If Juggernaut can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under your control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, you're not forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

mainBoard.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

mainBoard.flavorText: Only leonin clerics who can survive the Razor Fields for one turning of the suns can stand in the Cave of Light.
mainBoard.name: Leonin Abunas
mainBoard.originalText: Artifacts you control can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.
mainBoard.text: Artifacts you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Somehow it warps the Æther. It brings a strange weight, a blockade in the flow of spellcraft."
—Noyan Dar, Tazeem lullmage
mainBoard.name: Lodestone Golem
mainBoard.originalText: Nonartifact spells cost {1} more to cast.

rulings.text: The ability affects each spell that's not an artifact spell, including your own.

The ability affects the total cost of each nonartifact spell, but it doesn't change that spell's mana cost or mana value. The extra mana also doesn't change how many times you kicked the spell or what the value of X is (if applicable).
When determining a spell's total cost, effects that increase the cost are applied before effects that reduce the cost.

mainBoard.text: Nonartifact spells cost {1} more to cast.

mainBoard.flavorText: "These benighted worlds are thick with ignorance. I will educate them. They will listen, or they will die."
mainBoard.name: Magister Sphinx
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Magister Sphinx enters the battlefield, target player's life total becomes 10.

rulings.text: For a player’s life total to become 10, what actually happens is that the player gains or loses the appropriate amount of life. For example, if the targeted player’s life total is 4 when this ability resolves, it will cause that player to gain 6 life; alternately, if the targeted player’s life total is 17 when this ability resolves, it will cause that player to lose 7 life. Other cards that interact with life gain or life loss will interact with this effect accordingly.
This ability is not optional.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, this ability basically causes the team’s life total to become 10, but only the targeted player is considered to have actually gained or lost life.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Magister Sphinx enters, target player's life total becomes 10.

mainBoard.flavorText: "Wasted potential surrounds us. Lend me that bauble, and let me see what it can be made to be."
mainBoard.name: Master Transmuter
mainBoard.originalText: {U}, {T}, Return an artifact you control to its owner's hand: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Master Transmuter can be returned to its owner's hand to pay the cost of its activated ability.

The artifact card you put onto the battlefield when the ability resolves may be the same card that you returned to your hand when you paid the cost. If so, it returns to the battlefield as a new object with no relation to its previous existence.

mainBoard.text: {U}, {T}, Return an artifact you control to its owner's hand: You may put an artifact card from your hand onto the battlefield.

mainBoard.flavorText: In the blur between metal and flesh, Memnarch found madness.
mainBoard.name: Memnarch
mainBoard.originalText:
{1}{U}{U}: Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact.

rulings.text: The effects of Memnarch’s abilities don’t end at end of turn, and they don’t end when Memnarch leaves the battlefield. Both effects last until the affected permanent leaves the battlefield.
You can use the first ability on a nonartifact permanent, wait for the ability to resolve, and then use the second ability on that permanent.

mainBoard.text:
{1}{U}{U}: Target permanent becomes an artifact in addition to its other types. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
{3}{U}: Gain control of target artifact. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

mainBoard.flavorText: "By the time I got there, the heart had stopped. Fortunately, I was able to replace it with something better."
mainBoard.name: Metallurgeon
mainBoard.originalText: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

rulings.text: The only difference between a colored artifact and a colorless artifact is, obviously, its color. Unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact requires colored mana to cast. Also unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact has a color in all zones. It will interact with cards that care about color. Other than that, a colored artifact behaves just like any other artifact. It will interact as normal with any card that cares about artifacts, such as Shatter or Arcbound Ravager.

mainBoard.text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

mainBoard.flavorText: As their supplies of etherium dwindled, mechanists sent gargoyles farther and farther afield in search of salvage.
mainBoard.name: Sanctum Gargoyle
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
When Sanctum Gargoyle enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The only difference between a colored artifact and a colorless artifact is, obviously, its color. Unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact requires colored mana to cast. Also unlike most artifacts, a colored artifact has a color in all zones. It will interact with cards that care about color. Other than that, a colored artifact behaves just like any other artifact. It will interact as normal with any card that cares about artifacts, such as Shatter or Arcbound Ravager.

mainBoard.text:
Flying
When Sanctum Gargoyle enters, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

mainBoard.name: Sundering Titan
mainBoard.originalText: When Sundering Titan enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, choose a land of each basic land type, then destroy those lands.

rulings.text: If a land has more than one basic land type, it can be chosen more than once.
If one of the basic land types isn't present, it isn't chosen. If the only land of a certain type is one you control, you must choose it.
Players can't take actions in between the time you choose the lands and the time you destroy them. Notably, they can't activate mana abilities of those lands.

Sundering Titan's ability isn't targeted. When it resolves, Sundering Titan's controller must choose one land for each basic land type (Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest), and then they are destroyed simultaneously.

mainBoard.text: When Sundering Titan enters or leaves the battlefield, choose a land of each basic land type, then destroy those lands.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"We order them to stand, they stand. We order them to wait, they wait. We order them to die, they die."
—Pontifex, elder researcher
mainBoard.name: Synod Centurion
mainBoard.originalText: When you control no other artifacts, sacrifice Synod Centurion.
mainBoard.text: When you control no other artifacts, sacrifice Synod Centurion.

mainBoard.flavorText: Life's circle has become inverted in Grixis. The same energy is endlessly recycled and becomes more stagnant with each pass.
mainBoard.name: Agony Warp
mainBoard.originalText:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets -0/-3 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The two targets may be the same creature or they may be different creatures.

mainBoard.text:
Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets -0/-3 until end of turn.

mainBoard.name: Batwing Brume
mainBoard.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn if {W} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. Each player loses 1 life for each attacking creature he or she controls if {B} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. (Do both if {W}{B} was spent.)

rulings.text: If the spell is copied, the copy will never have had mana of the stated color paid for it, no matter what colors were spent on the original spell.
The spell cares about what mana was spent to pay its total cost, not just what mana was spent to pay the hybrid part of its cost.
The spell checks on resolution to see if any mana of the stated colors was spent to pay its cost. If so, it doesn’t matter how much mana of that color was spent.

mainBoard.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn if {W} was spent to cast this spell. Each player loses 1 life for each attacking creature they control if {B} was spent to cast this spell. (Do both if {W}{B} was spent.)

mainBoard.name: Spin into Myth
mainBoard.originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library, then fateseal 2. (To fateseal 2, look at the top two cards of an opponent's library, then put any number of them on the bottom of that player's library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: The opponent chosen for the fateseal action doesn’t have to be the player who controlled the target creature.

mainBoard.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library, then fateseal 2. (To fateseal 2, look at the top two cards of an opponent's library, then put any number of them on the bottom of that player's library and the rest on top in any order.)

mainBoard.flavorText: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.
mainBoard.name: Unmake
mainBoard.originalText: Exile target creature.
mainBoard.text: Exile target creature.

mainBoard.flavorText:
"Release that which was never caged."
—Spellbomb inscription
mainBoard.name: Aether Spellbomb
mainBoard.originalText:
{U}, Sacrifice Æther Spellbomb: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
{1}, Sacrifice Æther Spellbomb: Draw a card.
mainBoard.text:
{U}, Sacrifice Aether Spellbomb: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
{1}, Sacrifice Aether Spellbomb: Draw a card.

mainBoard.flavorText: The maze-like design embodies the core of Azorius law—strict structure designed to test wills and stall change.
mainBoard.name: Azorius Signet
mainBoard.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: An emblem of a secret guild, the Dimir insignia is seen only by its own members—and the doomed.
mainBoard.name: Dimir Signet
mainBoard.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {U}{B} to your mana pool.

mainBoard.flavorText: Only the Eldrazi mind thinks in the warped paths required to open the hedrons and tap the power within.
mainBoard.name: Dreamstone Hedron
mainBoard.originalText:
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Dreamstone Hedron: Draw three cards.
mainBoard.text:
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Dreamstone Hedron: Draw three cards.

mainBoard.name: Everflowing Chalice
mainBoard.originalText:
Multikicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Everflowing Chalice enters the battlefield with a charge counter on it for each time it was kicked.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool for each charge counter on Everflowing Chalice.

rulings.text: You can cast Everflowing Chalice without kicking it at all if you wish. However, if Everflowing Chalice has no charge counters on it, activating its last ability won't produce any mana.

mainBoard.text:
Multikicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Everflowing Chalice enters with a charge counter on it for each time it was kicked.
{T}: Add {C} for each charge counter on Everflowing Chalice.

mainBoard.name: Fieldmist Borderpost
mainBoard.originalText:
You may pay {1} and return a basic land you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Fieldmist Borderpost's mana cost.
Fieldmist Borderpost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: As you cast a spell, you get a chance to activate mana abilities before you pay that spell's costs. Therefore, you may tap a basic land for mana, then both spend that mana and return that land to your hand to pay this card's alternative cost. (Of course, you can return a different basic land instead.)

Casting this card by paying its alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast it. You can cast it only at the normal time you could cast an artifact spell. It also doesn't change the spell's mana cost or mana value. The only difference is the cost you actually pay.
Effects that increase or reduce the cost to cast this card will apply to whichever cost you chose to pay.
To satisfy the alternative cost, you may return any basic land you control to its owner's hand, regardless of that land's subtype or whether it's tapped.

mainBoard.text:
You may pay {1} and return a basic land you control to its owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Fieldmist Borderpost enters tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

mainBoard.flavorText: After lightning struck the cliffs, the ore became iron, the iron became steel, and the steel became greaves. The lightning never left.
mainBoard.name: Lightning Greaves
mainBoard.originalText:
Equipped creature has shroud and haste.
Equip {0}

rulings.text: If a creature enters the battlefield under your control and gains haste, but then loses it before attacking, it won't be able to attack that turn. This means that you can't use one Lightning Greaves to allow two new creatures to attack in the same turn.

You can't simply unequip Equipment from a creature. If Lightning Greaves is attached to the only creature you control, you won't be able to attach other equipment to it (or target it with anything else) until you have another creature onto which you can move Lightning Greaves.

mainBoard.text:
Equipped creature has haste and shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {0}

mainBoard.name: Mistvein Borderpost
mainBoard.originalText:
You may pay {1} and return a basic land you control to its owner's hand rather than pay Mistvein Borderpost's mana cost.
Mistvein Borderpost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

rulings.text: As you cast a spell, you get a chance to activate mana abilities before you pay that spell's costs. Therefore, you may tap a basic land for mana, then both spend that mana and return that land to your hand to pay this card's alternative cost. (Of course, you can return a different basic land instead.)

Casting this card by paying its alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast it. You can cast it only at the normal time you could cast an artifact spell. It also doesn't change the spell's mana cost or mana value. The only difference is the cost you actually pay.
Effects that increase or reduce the cost to cast this card will apply to whichever cost you chose to pay.
To satisfy the alternative cost, you may return any basic land you control to its owner's hand, regardless of that land's subtype or whether it's tapped.

mainBoard.text:
You may pay {1} and return a basic land you control to its owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Mistvein Borderpost enters tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.

mainBoard.flavorText: It is a monument as austere, unyielding, and inscrutable as Esper itself.
mainBoard.name: Obelisk of Esper
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B} to your mana pool.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Add {W}, {U}, or {B}.

mainBoard.flavorText: Only a focused mind can survive it.
mainBoard.name: Skullcage
mainBoard.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Skullcage deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she has exactly three or exactly four cards in hand.

rulings.text: Skullcage doesn’t check hand size when it triggers, only when it resolves.
Skullcage’s ability deals damage if the player has zero, one, two, five, or more than five cards in hand when its ability resolves.

mainBoard.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Skullcage deals 2 damage to that player unless they have exactly three or exactly four cards in hand.

mainBoard.flavorText: Simun the Quiet filled the chest with his most precious thoughts. But in a fit of paranoia, he locked up the memory of where he hid the key.
mainBoard.name: Sorcerer's Strongbox
mainBoard.originalText: {2}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, sacrifice Sorcerer's Strongbox and draw three cards.

rulings.text: If you lose the flip, nothing happens.
If you no longer control Sorcerer’s Strongbox by the time you win the flip, you won’t be able to sacrifice it. You’ll still draw three cards, though.

mainBoard.text: {2}, {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, sacrifice Sorcerer's Strongbox and draw three cards.

mainBoard.name: Sun Droplet
mainBoard.originalText:
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many charge counters on Sun Droplet.
At the beginning of each upkeep, you may remove a charge counter from Sun Droplet. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

mainBoard.text:
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many charge counters on Sun Droplet.
At the beginning of each upkeep, you may remove a charge counter from Sun Droplet. If you do, you gain 1 life.

mainBoard.name: Synod Sanctum
mainBoard.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Exile target permanent you control.
{2}, Sacrifice Synod Sanctum: Return all cards exiled with Synod Sanctum to the battlefield under your control.
mainBoard.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target permanent you control.
{2}, Sacrifice Synod Sanctum: Return all cards exiled with Synod Sanctum to the battlefield under your control.

mainBoard.name: Thunderstaff
mainBoard.originalText:
If Thunderstaff is untapped and a creature would deal combat damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
{2}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If Thunderstaff is untapped, it prevents 1 damage from each creature, each time it would deal combat damage to you. So if three creatures with double strike attack you and aren’t blocked, Thunderstaff will prevent a total of 6 damage.

mainBoard.text:
As long as Thunderstaff is untapped, if a creature would deal combat damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
{2}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: Creations made in madness may contain great power. The path to that power is as labyrinthine as the creator's mind.
mainBoard.name: Unbender Tine
mainBoard.originalText: {T}: Untap another target permanent.
mainBoard.text: {T}: Untap another target permanent.

mainBoard.name: March of the Machines
mainBoard.originalText: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

rulings.text: Each artifact land has a mana value of 0. March of the Machines makes them 0/0 creatures, which are put into the graveyard as a state-based action.
If a noncreature artifact is also another card type, such as enchantment or land, it will retain those types in addition to being an artifact creature.

If an Equipment becomes a creature, it can no longer equip a creature. If it's currently attached to a creature, it becomes unattached (but remains on the battlefield). You can activate the Equipment's equip ability, but it won't do anything.

If a noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature this way and then another effect animates it, the new effect overrides March of the Machines's effect. For example, Chimeric Staff is a 4/4 creature while March of the Machines is on the battlefield. If you activate Chimeric Staff's ability and choose X = 5, Chimeric Staff will be a 5/5 artifact creature for the rest of the turn.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn.

mainBoard.text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its mana value. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

mainBoard.originalText: U

mainBoard.originalText: B

mainBoard.name: Terramorphic Expanse
mainBoard.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
mainBoard.text: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
